Put it on a USB drive, and then walk it to the linux PC, and plug it in (walking, on sneakers, hence the "sneakernet")
you've got the ndiswrapper deb file for your version of ubuntu, right?  If so, copy it onto your desktop (so you'll have it for later if you need it) and then double click it.

if you don't have it in a deb for your vrsion, http://packages.ubuntu.com/cgi-bin/search_packages.pl?keywords=ndiswrapper&searchon=names&subword=1&version=feisty&release=all  click the package you want, then at the bottom of that page, there's a table with arches (386, x64, etc), click the one you want, and you'll get mirrors.
deb is debian format, yeah.  But debian debs aren't necessarily compatable with ubuntu ones (because of naming/versioning differences with dependencies, mostl)
